dt: {bc}a thick flat triangular movable bone that forms the anterior point of the knee and protects the front of the joint {bc}{sx|patella||}

dt.t: … [Richard] Steadman did arthroscopic surgery on both knees, taking out cartilage, and adjusting synovial plica, the bands of thickened tissue that line the joint behind the {wi}kneecaps{/wi} …
Many people who play basketball, volleyball, or soccer are all too familiar with patellar tendinitis, an inflammation of the large tendon connecting the {wi}kneecap{/wi} to the upper tibia.
The stifle joint of a horse corresponds to the human knee. It has a patella, or {wi}kneecap{/wi}, at the front of the joint.

shortdef: a thick flat triangular movable bone that forms the anterior point of the knee and protects the front of the joint : patella

dt: {bc}to shoot or otherwise maim or cripple the knee of (someone)

dt.t: He was shot in both knees, deliberately maimed—{ldquo}{wi}kneecapped{/wi},{rdquo} in local parlance.

… punishing petty crooks and unruly juveniles by {wi}kneecapping{/wi} them, sometimes with bullets, sometimes with a … power drill. The degree of crippling one receives is supposed to be a reflection of the gravity of one's crime.

… hearing from people who grasp their brows in dire concern over whether the President is now too damaged to carry on—this from people who have been doing their … best to {wi}kneecap{/wi} the man for years.
This 66-yard scoring drive Smith engineered late in the first half … basically {wi}kneecapped{/wi} the home team.
The decision to liquidate $25 million worth of the band's Live Nation stock last year nearly {wi}kneecapped{/wi} the company …

shortdef: to shoot or otherwise maim or cripple the knee of (someone) — often used figuratively

dt: {bc}a thick flat triangular movable bone that forms the anterior point of the knee and protects the front of the joint {bc}{sx|kneecap||}

dt.t: … the quadriceps are attached at the anterior and anterior lateral aspect of the {wi}patella{/wi} and are extensors of the knee joint.
… a few horses suffer from a slipping of the {wi}patella{/wi}—the little bone on the front of the stifle that is similar to the human kneecap—locking the joint so that it cannot flex properly.

The human knee is specialized for walking upright too: to compensate for the thighbone's being at an angle, there's a lump, or groove, at the end of the femur that prevents the {wi}patella{/wi} from sliding off the joint.

aq.auth: Michael D. Lemonick and Andrea Dorfman

et: Latin, from diminutive of {it}patina{/it} shallow dish
shortdef: a thick flat triangular movable bone that forms the anterior point of the knee and protects the front of the joint : kneecap
